== Main Inclusion Report for libgda3 ==

# ''Availability:'' http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/universe/libg/libgda3/; available for all architectures.
# ''Rationale:''
** Maintained version of `libgda`.
** Build-Depends of `gnome-python-extras`.
 0. ''Security:''
** <nowiki>[[http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvekey.cgi?keyword=libgda|CVE entries]]</nowiki>: One entry for the old version of `libgda`.
** <nowiki>[[http://secunia.com/search/?search=libgda|Secunia history]]</nowiki>: Same one entry as above.
** No binaries running as root or suid/sgid.  No daemons.
** Network activity: As it is in touch with database servers, it does handle incoming network data.
** No source code review performed.
 0. ''Quality assurance:''
** In what situations does the package not work out of the box without configuration ? None.
** Does the package ask any debconf questions higher than priority 'medium' ? No.
** <nowiki>[[http://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/pkgreport.cgi?src=libgda3|Debian bugs]]</nowiki>: No open bugs.
** <nowiki>[[http://packages.qa.debian.org/libg/libgda3.html|Maintenance in Debian]]</nowiki> is good.
** <nowiki>[[http://www.gnome-db.org/]]</nowiki> is well maintained.
** <nowiki>[[http://bugzilla.gnome.org/buglist.cgi?query_format=advanced&short_desc_type=allwordssubstr&short_desc=&product=libgda&version=2.99.x&version=3.0.x&long_desc_type=substring&long_desc=&status_whiteboard_type=allwordssubstr&status_whiteboard=&keywords_type=allwords&keywords=&bug_status=UNCONFIRMED&bug_status=NEW&bug_status=ASSIGNED&bug_status=REOPENED&bug_status=NEEDINFO&emailassigned_to1=1&emailtype1=substring&email1=&emailassigned_to2=1&emailreporter2=1&emailqa_contact2=1&emailcc2=1&emailtype2=substring&email2=&bugidtype=include&bug_id=&chfieldfrom=&chfieldto=Now&chfieldvalue=&cmdtype=doit&order=Reuse+same+sort+as+last+time&field0-0-0=noop&type0-0-0=noop&value0-0-0=|Upstream bug tracker]]</nowiki>: (Looks good.)
